wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Graver (8 September 1897 – 1950) was an English footballer who played as an inside right or centre forward. He appeared in the Football League for Grimsby Town, although he played more for their reserve team in the Midland League, Leeds United and Southend United. Graver also played for Burnhope Institute and for North-Eastern League clubs Darlington, for whom he scored 14 league goals and 2 in the FA Cup, Shildon Athletic, West Stanley, for whom he scored 41 league goals, and Wallsend.His son Andy remains, as of March 2016, Lincoln City's all-time top scorer.
